Androids.description: Semi-organic beings created by advanced technology with artificial intelligence

abilities.name: CONSTRUCT
abilities.description: +2 to recover from being Shaken, don't breathe, ignore one level of Wound modifiers, and are immune to poison and disease. Cannot heal naturally - require Repair skill.

abilities.name: OUTSIDER (Major)
abilities.description: Subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls when interacting with anyone besides other androids, and have no legal rights in most areas.

abilities.name: PACIFIST (Major)
abilities.description: Unless designed for combat, most have 'Asimov Circuits' - may not injure a sapient being or allow such harm through inaction.

abilities.name: VOW (Major)
abilities.description: Designed with a particular purpose - have a Major Vow to serve a corporation, faction, or directive.

Aquarians.description: Aquatic folk from the crushing ocean depths, sturdy beneath the waves

abilities.name: AQUATIC
abilities.description: Cannot drown in water and move at full Pace when swimming.

abilities.name: DEPENDENCY
abilities.description: Must immerse in water one hour out of every 24 or become automatically Fatigued each day until Incapacitated.

abilities.name: LOW LIGHT VISION
abilities.description: Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

abilities.name: TOUGHNESS
abilities.description: Add +1 to Toughness due to tough, resilient flesh.

Avions.description: Humanoids with wings and hollow bones, capable of flight

abilities.name: CAN'T SWIM
abilities.description: Wings are a hazard in water. Subtract 2 from Athletics (swimming) rolls and each inch moved in water costs 3″ of Pace.

abilities.name: FLIGHT
abilities.description: Fly at Pace 12 per round. Use Athletics when maneuvering.

abilities.name: FRAIL
abilities.description: −1 Toughness due to hollow bones.

abilities.name: KEEN SENSES
abilities.description: Begin with a d6 in Notice (instead of d4) and may raise the skill to d12 + 1.

abilities.name: REDUCED PACE
abilities.description: Dependence on flight makes them slower when walking. Decrease walking Pace by 1 and running die by one step.

Dwarves.description: Short but stout, hardy people from caverns and mountains

abilities.name: LOW LIGHT VISION
abilities.description: Dwarven eyes are accustomed to the dark. Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

abilities.name: REDUCED PACE
abilities.description: Short legs compared to most. Decrease Pace by 1 and running die one die type.

abilities.name: TOUGH
abilities.description: Stout and tough. Start with a d6 Vigor instead of a d4. This increases maximum Vigor to d12 + 1.

Elves.description: Graceful and long-lived magical beings with pointed ears

abilities.name: AGILE
abilities.description: Graceful and agile. Start with a d6 in Agility instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12 + 1.

abilities.name: ALL THUMBS
abilities.description: Have an inherent dislike of mechanical objects, and thus have the All Thumbs Hindrance.

abilities.name: LOW LIGHT VISION
abilities.description: Elven eyes amplify light. Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

Half-Elves.description: Children of human and elf parents, with heritage of both worlds

abilities.name: HERITAGE
abilities.description: May either start with a free Novice Edge of choice OR a d6 in Agility instead of a d4 (which increases Agility maximum to d12 + 1).

abilities.name: LOW LIGHT VISION
abilities.description: Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

abilities.name: OUTSIDER (Minor)
abilities.description: Never quite comfortable in human or elven society. Subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls with all but others of their kind.

Half-Folk.description: Small, optimistic people with a 'never say die' attitude

abilities.name: LUCK
abilities.description: Draw one additional Benny per game session.

abilities.name: REDUCED PACE
abilities.description: Decrease Pace by 1 and running die one die type.

abilities.name: SIZE −1
abilities.description: Average about four feet tall, reducing Size (and therefore Toughness) by 1.

abilities.name: SPIRITED
abilities.description: Generally optimistic beings. Start with a d6 Spirit instead of a d4. This increases maximum Spirit to d12 + 1.

Humans.description: Versatile and adaptable, the most common ancestry

abilities.name: ADAPTABLE
abilities.description: Begin play with any Novice Edge of their choosing. They must meet its Requirements as usual.

Rakashans.description: Humanoid felines with claws, fangs, and a predatory nature

abilities.name: AGILE
abilities.description: Feline grace gives a d6 Agility attribute instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12 + 1.

abilities.name: BITE/CLAWS
abilities.description: Fangs and claws are Natural Weapons that cause Strength+d4 damage.

abilities.name: BLOODTHIRSTY
abilities.description: Can be cruel to their foes, often toying with them. They rarely take prisoners and feel little compunction about punishing captured foes.

abilities.name: CAN'T SWIM
abilities.description: Actually can swim, they just shun it. Subtract 2 from Athletics (swimming) rolls and each inch of movement in water uses 3″ of Pace.

abilities.name: LOW LIGHT VISION
abilities.description: Eyes amplify light. Ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

abilities.name: ANCESTRAL ENEMY
abilities.description: Pick a common ancestry in your setting. Members of each culture subtract 2 from Persuasion when dealing with each other and often attack on sight.

Saurians.description: Lizard folk from steaming jungles with scaly skin and keen senses

abilities.name: ARMOR +2
abilities.description: Scaly skin that acts as leather armor.

abilities.name: BITE
abilities.description: Fangs are Natural Weapons that cause Strength+d4 damage.

abilities.name: ENVIRONMENTAL WEAKNESS
abilities.description: Though not truly cold-blooded, poorly suited for frigid conditions. Suffer a −4 penalty to resist cold environmental effects, and suffer +4 damage from cold-based attacks.

abilities.name: KEEN SENSES
abilities.description: Have acute senses, giving them the Alertness Edge.

abilities.name: OUTSIDER (Minor)
abilities.description: Most species distrust saurians. Subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls with all but others of their kind.
